group_1.textCenter: (The chimes have finished ringing, and I'm on the@rooftop of the school where I've hidden my trace...)
(However, the sky is filled with stars, and it feels@as if they alone are peering directly at me...)
(The stars have long observed the existence of@Magical Girls as well as the history of the Earth.)
(I am afraid that I, too, have been perceived as@one of those girls destined to disappear.)
(I have been "recognized" as such a hollow@existence...)

group_1.textRight: I am here again today with you, Himuro-senpai,@seeking recognition from the stars.

group_1.textLeft: All I do is lie awake at night, gazing at the stars.
Normally, I'd think it would be a hassle to keep@me company, but...

group_1.textRight: I'm not here to keep you company.@I'm here because I like you.

group_1.textLeft: *Sigh*...@But unlike me, you're the popular girl in class.
Now return to your friends and enjoy a happy@school life.

group_1.textRight: But I have no interest in other people at all.
Despite being the center of attention in class,@I'm simply striving to maintain appearances.
Truly, I have no real interest in bonding and@getting along with the class.
That's why the distance between you and I is@comfortable and not overbearing, you know?

group_1.textLeft: ...I shouldn't be of interest to you, either.

group_1.textRight: I am only interested in you, Himuro-senpai.
Moreover, I feel like I've finally grasped what@you were saying
when I first came to the rooftop.

group_1.narration: "A purposeless, unrecognizable, empty existence such as@mine preserves itself by being observed by many."

group_1.textLeft: Essentially, that statement echoes the lonely@musings of someone
deeply longing for companionship yet feeling@utterly marooned in solitude.

group_1.textRight: You know, I'm a bundle of contradictions like@that myself.
I'm supposed to be good at getting along with@people and forming connections.
Yet, I can't seem to discern meaning from any of it.

group_1.textLeft: Such a waste, yet so enviable.

group_1.narration: "In a world where existence itself, not just the self,@is shaped by others' perceptions, you possess more@than enough potential to be recognized."
"I believe you can manage just fine without@actively seeking ties to the world, simply by@embracing the stars as if they possess a will,@much like I do."

group_1.textRight: That awful expression on your face, as if pleading@me not to leave.

group_1.textLeft: I don't know what the existence I call "myself" is,@any more than ever...
I don't want to admit to myself that I'm no longer@a human being...
I wonder what the moon and the stars would think,@having watched a history that is almost eternal.
Compared to the sun, which lays everything bare@in the light of day,
I had thought of them as gentle beings who@provide comfort.
But now, instead of comforting me, it seems@they're merely mocking me...

group_1.textRight: My watchful eye has held you for as long as it@has the moon and the stars, and I can assure you.
Don't worry.@You are a human being, Himuro-senpai.

group_1.textLeft: ...Thank you, Shirogane.@I have a little more confidence in myself now.
Will you meet me here again?

group_1.textRight: Yes, I will come to suit myself.

group_1.narration: I just sensed a Witch's reaction...@If you are around, would it be possible@to speak with you all...?
I'm controlled by the feeling that I'm trapped@in something from which there is no escape,@and I don't even know who I am anymore...
